meaningMnemonic: You know how 経 means <kanji>passage of time</kanji>, right? Well, this is the verb form of that. What does time do when it passages? It passes. So, this verb means <vocabulary>to pass</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to elapse</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: What do you say to time as it begins <vocabulary>to pass</vocabulary> you by? "<reading>Ta</reading> ta (た), Time!"
